sentences.english: She was the first one to open my eyes to Hemingway, Faulkner, and other literary giants.
sentences.chinese: 是她带我进入海明威和福克纳等文学巨匠的世界。

sentences.english: Their independence from great masters of the heart, display their energy.
sentences.chinese: 他们独巨匠心，各显其能。

sentences.english: I want to get along with everyone.
Sounds solid: made by the mallet of Los Demiurgos.
sentences.chinese: 听上去蛮实，一定是巨匠造物主那把木槌的响声。

sentences.english: He became a global literary celebrity.
Dryden and Pope are the great masters of the artificial style of poetry in English language.
sentences.chinese: 德莱顿和蒲伯是英语诗歌中人为风格的巨匠。

sentences.english: Please be quiet, lads, I'm trying to give a team-talk.
sentences.chinese: 巨匠存候静，我正在进行球队演讲。

sentences.english: They both have received their PPA Master of Photography and Photographic Craftsman degrees.
sentences.chinese: 他们二人同时获得PPA摄影硕士和摄影巨匠学位。

sentences.english: Today is Lantern Festival. First of all, I wish you and your family a happy festival!
sentences.chinese: 今天是元宵节，首先祝巨匠节日欢愉，阖家团聚。

definition: (abbr. for 泰山北斗[Tai4 Shan1 Bei3 dou3]) distinguished figure/doyen/revered authority
monstre sacré (i.e. artist famous for being deliberately preposterous)
representative individual (of a school of thought)
